## Discussion

The URL is converted into a match pattern and will update [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebExtensionContext/grantedPermissionMatchPatterns] and [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebExtensionContext/deniedPermissionMatchPatterns]. # setPermissionStatus(_:for:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the permission status of a URL with a distant future expiration date.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func setPermissionStatus(_ status: WKWebExtensionContext.PermissionStatus, for url: URL)
```

## Parameters

- **status**: The new permission status to set for the given URL.
- **url**: The URL for which to set the status.

## Discussion

The URL is converted into a match pattern and will update [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebExtensionContext/grantedPermissionMatchPatterns] and [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebExtensionContext/deniedPermissionMatchPatterns]. Use this method for changing a single URL’s status. Only [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebExtensionContext/PermissionStatus/deniedExplicitly], [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebExtensionContext/PermissionStatus/unknown], and [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebExtensionContext/PermissionStatus/grantedExplicitly] states are allowed to be set using this method.

## Related Documentation

- **setPermissionStatus(_:for:expirationDate:)**: Sets the permission status of a URL with a distant future expiration date.
